intro: Cavendishia cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas' Cavendishia, is a rare and striking plant native to Ecuador. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, colorful inflorescence that resembles a torch. The plant features strap-like leaves that form a rosette, creating a unique architectural shape. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its limited distribution and conservation status, it is considered a valuable species in botanical research and conservation efforts.
